result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on May 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Trista A Strook in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Deft has picked up new charges in case 16CM698.
BTC: Matter adjourned.
  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Status conference at 04-08-2016 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with Kohls except for restitution purposes.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Trista A Strook in court.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
